Detailed Description

This class is a control that displays an image.

Definition at line 67 of file CPImageView.j.

- (void) layoutSubviews   [implementation]

Definition at line 260 of file CPImageView.j.

00261 {
00262     if (![self image])
00263         return;
00264 
00265     var bounds = [self bounds],
00266         image = [self image],
00267         imageScaling = [self currentValueForThemeAttribute:@"image-scaling"],
00268         x = 0.0,
00269         y = 0.0,
00270         insetWidth = (_hasShadow ? HORIZONTAL_SHADOW_INSET : 0.0),
00271         insetHeight = (_hasShadow ? VERTICAL_SHADOW_INSET : 0.0),
00272         boundsWidth = _CGRectGetWidth(bounds),
00273         boundsHeight = _CGRectGetHeight(bounds),
00274         width = boundsWidth - insetWidth,
00275         height = boundsHeight - insetHeight;
00276 
00277     if (imageScaling === CPScaleToFit)
00278     {
00279 #if PLATFORM(DOM)
00280         _DOMImageElement.width = ROUND(width);
00281         _DOMImageElement.height = ROUND(height);
00282 #endif
00283     }
00284     else
00285     {
00286         var size = [image size];
00287         
00288         if (size.width == -1 && size.height == -1)
00289             return;
00290 
00291         if (imageScaling === CPScaleProportionally)
00292         {
00293             // The max size it can be is size.width x size.height, so only
00294             // only proportion otherwise.
00295             if (width >= size.width && height >= size.height)
00296             {
00297                 width = size.width;
00298                 height = size.height;
00299             }
00300             else
00301             {
00302                 var imageRatio = size.width / size.height,
00303                     viewRatio = width / height;
00304                     
00305                 if (viewRatio > imageRatio)
00306                     width = height * imageRatio;
00307                 else
00308                     height = width / imageRatio;
00309             }
00310 
00311 #if PLATFORM(DOM)
00312             _DOMImageElement.width = ROUND(width);
00313             _DOMImageElement.height = ROUND(height);
00314 #endif
00315         }
00316         else
00317         {
00318             width = size.width;
00319             height = size.height;
00320         }
00321     
00322         if (imageScaling == CPScaleNone)
00323         {
00324 #if PLATFORM(DOM)
00325             _DOMImageElement.width = ROUND(size.width);
00326             _DOMImageElement.height = ROUND(size.height);
00327 #endif
00328         }
00329 
00330         var x = (boundsWidth - width) / 2.0,
00331             y = (boundsHeight - height) / 2.0;
00332 
00333 #if PLATFORM(DOM)
00334         CPDOMDisplayServerSetStyleLeftTop(_DOMImageElement, NULL, x, y);
00335 #endif
00336     }
00337 
00338     _imageRect = _CGRectMake(x, y, width, height);
00339     
00340     if (_hasShadow)
00341         [_shadowView setFrame:_CGRectMake(x - LEFT_SHADOW_INSET, y - TOP_SHADOW_INSET, width + insetWidth, height + insetHeight)];
00342 }

- (void) setHasShadow: (BOOL)  shouldHaveShadow   [implementation]

Sets whether the image view should draw with a drop shadow.

Parameters:
shouldHaveShadow whether the image view should have a shadow

Definition at line 182 of file CPImageView.j.

00182                     :(BOOL)shouldHaveShadow
00183 {
00184     if (_hasShadow == shouldHaveShadow)
00185         return;
00186     
00187     _hasShadow = shouldHaveShadow;
00188 
00189     if (_hasShadow)
00190     {
00191         _shadowView = [[CPShadowView alloc] initWithFrame:[self bounds]];
00192                         
00193         [self addSubview:_shadowView];
00194         
00195         [self setNeedsLayout];
00196         [self setNeedsDisplay:YES];
00197     }
00198     else
00199     {
00200         [_shadowView removeFromSuperview];
00201         
00202         _shadowView = nil;
00203     }
00204     
00205     [self hideOrDisplayContents];
00206 }

Definition at line 120 of file CPImageView.j.

00120                       :(CPImage)anImage
00121 {
00122     var oldImage = [self objectValue];
00123     
00124     if (oldImage === anImage)
00125         return;
00126         
00127     [super setObjectValue:anImage];
00128     
00129     var defaultCenter = [CPNotificationCenter defaultCenter];
00130     
00131     if (oldImage)
00132         [defaultCenter removeObserver:self name:CPImageDidLoadNotification object:oldImage];
00133 
00134     var newImage = [self objectValue];
00135     
00136 #if PLATFORM(DOM)
00137     _DOMImageElement.src = newImage ? [newImage filename] : "";
00138 #endif
00139 
00140     var size = [newImage size];
00141     
00142     if (size && size.width === -1 && size.height === -1)
00143     {
00144         [defaultCenter addObserver:self selector:@selector(imageDidLoad:) name:CPImageDidLoadNotification object:newImage];
00145         
00146 #if PLATFORM(DOM)
00147         _DOMImageElement.width = 0;
00148         _DOMImageElement.height = 0;
00149 #endif
00150 
00151         [_shadowView setHidden:YES];
00152     }
00153     else
00154     {
00155         [self hideOrDisplayContents];
